case_title: MUHAMMAD ALI and 10 others vs NOOR MUHAMMAD through his Legal Heirs and others
reference_no_or_id: R.O.R. No.1665 of 1987 and Suo Motu R.O.R. No.1770 of 1988
complaint_summary: Petitioners challenged the execution of Conveyance Deed and subsequent mutations favoring Mst. Zainab Bibi, claiming violations of inheritance laws under Shariat Application Act, 1962.
investigation_summary: Court reviewed historical records, including judgments, mutations, and deeds. Evidence presented by Patwari, Colony Clerk, and Moharer Mall was analyzed.
judgment_summary: Court ruled that Mst. Zainab Bibi was a limited owner until her death. Her proprietary rights were rescinded, and fresh deeds ordered. Land was divided: 1/4th to her legal heirs and 3/4th to reversionaries of Suleman.
punishment: Rescission of Conveyance Deed executed under orders dated 12-9-1982 and 16-10-1982.
Decision_or_verdict: Orders accordingly; revision petitions disposed of.
legal_arguments: Petitioners argued Mst. Zainab Bibi was a limited owner under Shariat Application Act, 1962.
Respondents contended she was a full owner, but failed to provide supporting evidence.

disputed_land.location: Chak No.107/10-R, Tehsil and District Khanewal

statutes: West Pakistan Muslim Personal Law (Shariat) Application Act, 1962
sections: Section 30(2) of Colonization of Government Lands Act, 1912

witness_statement.Colony Clerk: Presented documents related to tenancy and ownership.

key_issues: Validity of Conveyance Deed executed in favor of Mst. Zainab Bibi.
Application of Shariat Law in inheritance matters.

share_distribution.reversionaries: 3/4 share (Muhammad Ali, Yaqub Ali, Muhammad Shafi, Ahmad Ali, Bashir Ahmad)

inheritance.Mst. Zainab Bibi death: Land inherited by Noor Muhammad (brother) and Mst. Aisha Bibi (sister)

legal_challenges.petitioners: Challenged mutation before Assistant Commissioner/Collector, Khanewal
legal_challenges.additional_commissioner_order: Restored mutation No.254 in favor of respondents

key_findings.ownership_status: Mst. Zainab Bibi was a limited owner till her death
key_findings.legal_reversion: Property reverts to legal heirs of Suleman deceased
key_findings.shariat_act_application: 1/4 share to respondents, 3/4 share to petitioners

orders.conveyance_deed: Rescinded under Section 30(2) of Colonization of Government Lands Act, 1912
orders.fresh_deeds: To be executed in accordance with court orders

legal_terms.Limited Owner: A person entitled to occupy or use property until death or remarriage.
legal_terms.Reversionary: Legal heir entitled to inherit property after the death of a limited owner.

words_and_phrases.Mutation: Change in ownership recorded in land revenue records.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves inheritance dispute over state land under Dakhilkari Scheme. Court ruled Mst. Zainab Bibi was a limited owner, and property was divided among legal heirs and reversionaries. Conveyance Deed rescinded.
